description: From New Latin grossularius, from translingual Grossularia, a subgenus of Ribes, including the gooseberry, from French groseille. The mineral name is in reference to a particular green variety found in Siberia.

adjectives.description: grossular (comparative more grossular, superlative most grossular)

entries.meaning: Relating to, or resembling, a gooseberry.
(mineralogy) A calcium-aluminium mineral of the garnet group.
